title: What is tennis?
content: Tennis is a racket sport played between two players (singles) or two teams of two players (doubles) on a rectangular court divided by a net.

title: How does scoring work in tennis?
content: Points are counted as 15, 30, 40, and game. If both players reach 40, it's called 'deuce' and a player must win two consecutive points to win the game.

title: What are the four Grand Slam tournaments?
content: The four Grand Slams are: Australian Open (January), French Open (May-June), Wimbledon (June-July), and US Open (August-September).

title: What are the different court surfaces?
content: The main surfaces are: hard court (fast game, consistent bounce), clay court (slow game, high bounce), and grass court (very fast game, low bounce).

title: What is an 'ace' in tennis?
content: An ace is a serve that the opponent cannot touch with their racket. It results in an immediate point for the server.
